plugins.name: Amplitude event import
plugins.description:
How it works?


Import your events into Figma with this easy tool, downloading the list of events you require from Amplitude -> Data -> Events in the download action, import the file exported through the plugin and you will be able to see your events in Figma.

plugins.name: Color Analyzer
plugins.description:
Color Analyzer is an intuitive Figma plugin that provides in-depth analysis of colors in your designs. Once you select an element, the plugin generates a square representing the analyzed color alongside comprehensive information:


Displays color values in HEX, RGB, and CMYK formats

Automatically calculates and shows contrast ratios against white (#FFF) and black (#000) backgrounds

Presents results in a clear, easy-to-read format next to the analyzed element


With Color Analyzer, you can quickly check WCAG accessibility compliance, optimize text readability, and ensure color consistency across your designs. Perfect for UI/UX designers who care about details and accessibility in their interfaces.
plugins.tagline: Detailed color analysis with HEX, RGB, CMYK values and contrast ratios for accessibility.

126884.name: Color Analyzer
126884.description:
Color Analyzer is an intuitive Figma plugin that provides in-depth analysis of colors in your designs. Once you select an element, the plugin generates a square representing the analyzed color alongside comprehensive information:

Presents results in a clear, easy-to-read format next to the analyzed element

126884.tagline: Detailed color analysis with HEX, RGB, CMYK values and contrast ratios for accessibility.

plugins.name: in any case
plugins.description:
From effortless case changes to instant text metrics, this plugin integrates perfectly with both Figma and FigJam, adapting to your workflow and style. Simplify your design process and keep your text consistent, no matter the case!


Apply the most popular case transformations with ease, including Title Case, Sentence case, UPPERCASE, lowercase, tOOGLE cASE, camelCase, kebab-case, snake_case, PascalCase, and flatcase. Easily convert the case of text across multiple layers, components, and instances at once, with maintaining your font styles and formatting while making those changes.


  1. Access case conversion and text stats instantly through the actions menu, speeding up your workflow. Simply use Cmd + / on Mac or Ctrl + / on Win
  2. View character, word, sentence, and paragraphs counts, which dynamically update as you type or select text
  3. See the results of your case changes immediately
  4. Enjoy full functionality in both Figma and FigJam
  5. Continue working in your preferrable Dark or Light modes with native Figma colors
  6. Rest assured that your data is safe – this plugin doesn’t store or send any of your text or design data
plugins.tagline: Instant case conversion and text metrics

108858.name: in any case
108858.description:
From effortless case changes to instant text metrics, this plugin integrates perfectly with both Figma and FigJam, adapting to your workflow and style. Simplify your design process and keep your text consistent, no matter the case!


Apply the most popular case transformations with ease, including Title Case, Sentence case, UPPERCASE, lowercase, tOOGLE cASE, camelCase, kebab-case, snake_case, PascalCase, and flatcase. Easily convert the case of text across multiple layers, components, and instances at once, with maintaining your font styles and formatting while making those changes.


  1. Access case conversion and text stats instantly through the actions menu, speeding up your workflow. Simply use Cmd + / on Mac or Ctrl + / on Win
  2. View character, word, sentence, and paragraphs counts, which dynamically update as you type or select text
  3. See the results of your case changes immediately
  4. Enjoy full functionality in both Figma and FigJam
  5. Continue working in your preferrable Dark or Light modes with native Figma colors
  6. Rest assured that your data is safe – this plugin doesn’t store or send any of your text or design data
108858.release_notes:
- Added PascalCase and flatcase for devs
- Updated UI
- Added multiple font styles preservation for multi paragraph texts
- Bug fixes and code improvements
108858.tagline: Instant case conversion and text metrics

plugins.name: Anchorify
plugins.description:
A Figma Plugin for converting Markdown-style links to clickable hyperlinks.


Turn [text](url), <a href="url">example</a>, and [url=url]text[/url] clickable.


Ideal for those syncing with Google Sheets! 📊

plugins.name: E3 Variant Finder
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin we developed for collaboration in our team. It allows programmers to find the required instance by provided component name and instance name.


Application area: it allows to simplify communication between programmer and designer, if you need to change not all instances of a component, but only one of them.


  1. The designer sends the programmer the full path to the variant in format: [Page] | [Component Name] | [Variant Name].
  2. The programmer inserts the received data into the plugin field and presses the Find button.
  3. The plugin selects and focuses on the desired variant.
plugins.tagline: Easily find the right variant

63321.name: E3 Variant Finder
63321.description:
A very simple plugin we developed for collaboration in our team. It allows programmers to find the required instance by provided component name and instance name.


Application area: it allows to simplify communication between programmer and designer, if you need to change not all instances of a component, but only one of them.


  1. The designer sends the programmer the full path to the variant in format: [Page] | [Component Name] | [Variant Name].
  2. The programmer inserts the received data into the plugin field and presses the Find button.
  3. The plugin selects and focuses on the desired variant.

plugins.name: Actio
plugins.description:
Actio allows you to resize frames based on an aspect ratio. With its easy-to-use interface, you can quickly define the width and height of your frames while preserving either value. No more tedious resizing and guessing!


Actio supports any aspect ratio and works with multiple selected frames.
plugins.tagline: Quickly resize frames to any aspect ratio

53999.name: Actio
53999.description:
Actio allows you to resize frames based on an aspect ratio. With its easy-to-use interface, you can quickly define the width and height of your frames while preserving either value. No more tedious resizing and guessing!


Actio supports any aspect ratio and works with multiple selected frames.
53999.tagline: Quickly resize frames to any aspect ratio

plugins.name: Iconic - Pixel Perfect Icons
plugins.description:
Iconic brings premium, “do wtf you want with” pixel-perfect icons right into Figma, making your design process seamless. With over 1400 icons available, you can find exactly what you need for any project—whether it’s a sleek UI element or a fun emoji. We add new icons every week, so there’s always something fresh to work with.


The plugin lets you search and copy icons as SVGs with ease or directly embed them onto your canvas, saving you time and hassle. It’s a simple way to enhance your designs without breaking your flow in Figma.


Pro icons require a paid subscription through iconic.app.
plugins.tagline: 1,400+ pixel perfect icons at your fingertips

132908.tagline: 1,400+ pixel perfect icons at your fingertips

plugins.name: Component Swapper
plugins.description:
Replaces the selected objects with similarly named objects from the library.


For example, if you need to replace one icon set with another. Works within any selected object including components.


The objects should differ by the beginning of their names, while the rest of the name should remain the same.

For example: a_icon → b_icon or filled_icon → outlined_icon.


To use it, you need to:

  1. Enter the library ID in the settings (⚙️)
  2. Enter your access token
  3. Enter a name fragment of the objects to be replaced and a fragment of the new objects' names
  4. Select the objects you want to replace and run the plugin


How to find the library ID

In your library, click Share and copy the link.

The library ID is the part that comes after /design/ in the URL:

www.figma.com/design/{file-id}/unnecessary_part_of_the_link


How to find the access token

Read the article in Figma’s documentation
plugins.tagline: Replaces the selected objects with similarly named objects from the library

plugins.name: Base64 Encoder
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that streamlines the process of using SVGs in web projects by automating the export, optimisation, and conversion to base64-encoded data URIs for both CSS and HTML.


Overview

If you've ever needed to embed SVGs directly in your code, you know the process can be tedious:


  1. Export the SVG from Figma
  2. Optimise it with a tool like SVGO
  3. Convert it to base64
  4. Format it properly for CSS or HTML


This plugin automates the entire workflow with a single click. Select any frame or element in Figma and instantly copy optimised, base64-encoded SVGs ready to use as:


HTML <img> tags

CSS background-image properties

CSS mask-image properties (with customisable colours)


When to Use Base64-Encoded SVGs


Base64-encoded SVGs are particularly useful for:


  1. Email templates where external images may be blocked or filtered
  2. CSS backgrounds and decorative elements when you want to avoid additional HTTP requests
  3. Custom list markers that need to maintain consistency across email clients
  4. Icon systems where you need a small number of icons without the overhead of an icon font
  5. Mask images in CSS when you need a shape with a customisable fill colour
  6. Offline applications or environments with limited connectivity
  7. Performance optimisation for small, frequently used graphics


In these scenarios, embedding SVGs directly in your code eliminates HTTP requests, avoids CORS issues, and ensures visual elements display correctly regardless of external resource availability.
plugins.tagline: Instantly export, optimise, and convert SVGs to base64 for CSS and HTML 🚀

124896.name: Base64 Encoder
124896.description:
A Figma plugin that streamlines the process of using SVGs in web projects by automating the export, optimisation, and conversion to base64-encoded data URIs for both CSS and HTML.

plugins.name: Typography Inspector
plugins.description: Typography Inspector helps you quickly analyze and manage text styles in your Figma designs. Select any frame, component, or group, and the plugin will display font details like typeface, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing. It also groups similar text styles for easy bulk selection and editing. Perfect for designers who want to maintain consistent typography across projects!

accepted.name: prosha amiri
accepted.description: I'm the kind of designer who builds like an engineer, thinks like a strategist, and sketches like an artist.

plugins.tagline: Analyze and manage text style in your figma design.

It also groups similar text styles for easy bulk selection and editing. Perfect for designers who want to maintain consistent typography across projects!

plugins.name: Modyo Responsive Font Size
plugins.description: This Figma plugin helps you easily calculate responsive font sizes using RFS (Responsive Font Size) formulas. Input minimum and maximum sizes for different screen resolutions, and the plugin generates CSS formulas with rem and vw units. The result includes font sizes and line-heights for various breakpoints. Make your designs adaptive and accessible across devices with ease.
plugins.tagline: Create RFS formulas for responsive font sizes in Figma – simple, effective, adaptive.

111067.name: Modyo Responsive Font Size
111067.description: This Figma plugin helps you easily calculate responsive font sizes using RFS (Responsive Font Size) formulas. Input minimum and maximum sizes for different screen resolutions, and the plugin generates CSS formulas with rem and vw units. The result includes font sizes and line-heights for various breakpoints. Make your designs adaptive and accessible across devices with ease.
111067.tagline: Create RFS formulas for responsive font sizes in Figma – simple, effective, adaptive.

plugins.name: Extract content strings
plugins.description:
Read the post and documentation for this plugin.

Download a test file.


This Figma plugin helps you surface and extract content strings from your designs by scanning your Figma file for text layer names containing unique IDs, making it easy to copy and paste content strings for use outside of Figma.


How this plugin works

This plugin scans text layers on the current page of Figma file for content that matches the prefix of the unique ID (e.g., “content_string_”) you define. Most developers rely on prefixes to organize and manage these strings, and a typical content string might look something like this:


key: 'user.profile.settings.modal.description'

value: 'Adjust your profile settings'

context: 'A brief description indicating the purpose of the modal.'


A content string can include additional details, like the “context” in this example, but it must always contain a unique ID (sometimes referred to as a key, ID, or token) and the actual content, often called the value:


key: 'user.profile.settings.modal.description'

value: 'Adjust your profile settings'


Developers use the unique ID in their code to reference and display the corresponding content. This approach is particularly useful when localizing content, allowing teams to manage translations easily. By separating content from the code, developers can easily swap out language-specific strings without disrupting the application.


How to use this plugin

This plugin requires some initial manual setup to link unique IDs with content. Once configured, you can quickly copy and paste all your content strings!


The plugin scans text layers on the current Figma page for content strings that match the prefix of the unique ID you define (e.g., “content_string_”).


For example, if your content strings begin with “user.profile”, you’ll use that as your prefix.


  1. Example unique ID: user.profile.settings.modal.description
  2. Your search prefix: user.profile


Ensure the full unique ID is used as the layer name for the corresponding text.


  1. Text layer name: user.profile.settings.modal.description


In summary

  1. Define a prefix for your content strings (e.g., “user.profile”).
  2. Ensure the full unique ID is used as the text layer name (e.g., “user.profile.settings.modal.description”).
  3. Enter your prefix and run a search.
  4. The plugin will scan the text layers and match content based on your prefix.
  5. Easily copy and paste the extracted content strings.
plugins.tagline: Extract content strings from you Figma files with unique IDs in layer names.

plugins.name: Text Localizer
plugins.description:
🚀 Simplify your localization workflow with our powerful Figma plugin!


The Localization Plugin scans all text layers within a selected frame and automatically binds them to Figma variables, making it effortless to manage translations and text updates. Whether you're working on multilingual designs or simply organizing your text layers more efficiently, this tool streamlines the process.


✨ Features:

✅ Scan Selected Frames – Instantly detect all text layers within a frame.

✅ Bind Text to Variables – Assign Figma variables to text layers for seamless localization.

✅ Export & Manage Text Layers – Save and load text layer collections with ease.

✅ CSV Export Support – Quickly export text data for external use.


🔍 How It Works:

1️⃣ Select a frame in Figma.

2️⃣ Open the Localization Plugin.

3️⃣ Scan the selected frame for text layers.

4️⃣ Bind text layers to variables or export them as CSV.

5️⃣ Apply changes instantly and manage text efficiently!


🌟 New Features (Version 1.2.0)

Smart Layer Selection: The plugin now automatically detects and unselects text layers that are already bound to variables, preventing accidental duplication and redundant work.

Visual Binding Indicators: Text layers that are already bound to variables are now clearly marked with a purple variable icon in a light green background, making it easier to identify localized content.

Improved UI Elements: Count badges in the "Generate Variables" button now have a more polished, pill-shaped design that follows Figma's design patterns.


✨ Improvements (Version 1.2.0)

Automatic UI Update: The interface now automatically refreshes after generating variables to show accurate binding status.

Better Visual Hierarchy: The redesigned interface makes it clearer which layers are available for localization and which are already handled.

Enhanced Tooltips: Added helpful tooltips to explain why certain layers are pre-unselected.


🛠️ Technical Updates (Version 1.2.0)

Async Layer Scanning: Layer scanning now uses async/await for improved performance and reliability.

Optimized Variable Detection: More robust detection of bound variables for accurate status representation.
plugins.tagline: Streamline your Figma design localization process

🛠️ Technical Updates (Version 1.2.0)

Async Layer Scanning: Layer scanning now uses async/await for improved performance and reliability.

Optimized Variable Detection: More robust detection of bound variables for accurate status representation.
120138.release_notes: V1.2.0 - Smarter layer selection, visual binding indicators, improved UI, and faster async scanning for a seamless localization workflow.
120138.tagline: Streamline your Figma design localization process

Recontent helps product teams collaborate on localization & product copy. No more hardcoded keys, outdated text or misleading translations.

– Connect a Figma file to a project

– Push all your content without leaving Figma

– Start designing & syncing content!

plugins.name: Luckino - Variables Import/Export JSON & CSS
plugins.description:
This plugin helps bridge the gap between Figma Variables and your design system implementation by allowing you to:



Import design tokens:


Import design tokens from W3C-compatible JSON format into Figma Variables

Preview tokens before importing to validate structure and values

Seamlessly map token values to the appropriate variable types

Support for color, number, and alias references


Export as standard formats:


Export Figma Variables to JSON following the W3C Design Tokens format

Generate CSS variables for immediate use in web development

Maintain references between variables during import/export

Filter by collections, modes, and variable types


Perfect for design system teams who want to keep Figma Variables in sync with their codebase, allowing designers and developers to work with the same source of truth.
plugins.tagline: Import and export design tokens between Figma Variables and standard formats like JSON and CSS.

  • Add page numbers to sections without them

plugins.name: Harris Profile
plugins.description:
Evaluate Your Ideas According to What Matters Most to You

The Harris Profile Method is a powerful tool that enables you to evaluate your ideas and select the most suitable one. This plugin helps designers compare three ideas by scoring them based on prioritized criteria.


A Step-by-Step Guide

Write the titles of the three concepts you want to compare in the title sections above.


Determine up to 7 comparison criteria and list them in descending order of importance, from top to bottom.


During criterion evaluation, score each criterion separately for all three concepts. Possible scores are -2, -1, +1, +2:

  1. +2 if it greatly meets your requirements
  2. -2 if it doesn't meet them at all

Intermediate scores reflect partial alignment.


After scoring all criteria, examine the resulting pattern. The option with the highest green density in the top rows indicates the most suitable concept for you.


Changing the priority order of your criteria will alter the scoring pattern. To see which concept is more valuable in different situations, rearrange them with the desired criterion.


Use "Clear All Scores" to keep your concept names and criteria fixed while only clearing scores.


When ready, click the Insert button to paste the Harris Profile table directly onto your Figma canvas.


For inquiries or support, contact us at: harris.profile.plugin@gmail.com


The Harris Profile as a Design Thinking Evaluation Method

The method is based on the following sources:


  1. HARRIS, John S. The Product Profile Chart: A Graphical Means of Appraising and Selecting New Products, 1961.
  2. ROOZENBURG, Norbert F.M.; EEKELS, Johannes. Product Design: Fundamentals and Methods, Wiley, 1995.


Method Card Toolkit

YouTube Overview Video
plugins.tagline: Score & Compare Ideas Based on Custom Criteria

107594.description:

  1. +2 if it greatly meets your requirements
  2. -2 if it doesn't meet them at all

Intermediate scores reflect partial alignment.


After scoring all criteria, examine the resulting pattern. The option with the highest green density in the top rows indicates the most suitable concept for you.


Changing the priority order of your criteria will alter the scoring pattern. To see which concept is more valuable in different situations, rearrange them with the desired criterion.


Use "Clear All Scores" to keep your concept names and criteria fixed while only clearing scores.

plugins.name: Flutter Color Variables
plugins.description:
Simple plugin that generates Flutter/Dart Color constants from your Figma color variables.


Example Export:

import 'dart:ui';

enum ColorsMode {
lightMode,
darkMode
}

class Colors {
// Single-value colors
static Color primaryColor = const Color(0xFF000000);

// Mode-dependent colors
static Color backgroundColor(ColorsMode mode) {
switch (mode) {
case ColorsMode.lightMode:
return const Color(0xFFFFFFFF);
case ColorsMode.darkMode:
return const Color(0xFF000000);
}
}
}
plugins.tagline: Generate Flutter/Dart code for your color variables

117023.name: Flutter Color Variables
117023.description:
Simple plugin that generates Flutter/Dart Color constants from your Figma color variables.


Example Export:

import 'dart:ui';

enum ColorsMode {
lightMode,
darkMode
}

class Colors {
// Single-value colors
static Color primaryColor = const Color(0xFF000000);

// Mode-dependent colors
static Color backgroundColor(ColorsMode mode) {
switch (mode) {
case ColorsMode.lightMode:
return const Color(0xFFFFFFFF);
case ColorsMode.darkMode:
return const Color(0xFF000000);
}
}
}
117023.tagline: Generate Flutter/Dart code for your color variables

plugins.name: DoJavaScript
plugins.description:
クリップボードにコピーしてあるJavaScriptをFigma上で実行できるプラグインです。


ユーティリティー系のアプリと組み合わせることで、Figmaのさまざまな操作をショートカットキーでカスタマイズすることを目的に作成しました。


想定しているユーティリティー系アプリはKeyboard Maestroです。

  1. Keyboard Maestroで、クリップボードにFigmaを操作するJavaScriptをセットする
  2. Keyboard MaestroでFigmaのメニューバーの［プラグイン］→［DoJavaScript］を選択する
  3. 実行が終わったらKeyboard Maestroでセットしたクリップボードは破棄する


Keyboard Maestroでこれら一連の操作をまとめたマクロにショートカットキーを設定すれば、好きなショートカットキーで任意のJavaScriptをFigma上で実行できるようになります。


■使用イメージ

下記投稿のようなFigma APIの実行を好きなショートカットキーで実行できるようになります。

https://twitter.com/31mskz10/status/1684541017561903104


これは下記のFigma APIを使ったJavaScriptをKeyboard Maestroでコピーし、プラグインを実行して実現しています。

const selection = figma.currentPage.selection.slice()
for (let node of selection) {
node.resize(200, 300)
}
plugins.tagline: Execute the JavaScript copied to the clipboard.

62054.name: DoJavaScript
62054.description:
クリップボードにコピーしてあるJavaScriptをFigma上で実行できるプラグインです。


ユーティリティー系のアプリと組み合わせることで、Figmaのさまざまな操作をショートカットキーでカスタマイズすることを目的に作成しました。


想定しているユーティリティー系アプリはKeyboard Maestroです。

  1. Keyboard Maestroで、クリップボードにFigmaを操作するJavaScriptをセットする
  2. Keyboard MaestroでFigmaのメニューバーの［プラグイン］→［DoJavaScript］を選択する
  3. 実行が終わったらKeyboard Maestroでセットしたクリップボードは破棄する


Keyboard Maestroでこれら一連の操作をまとめたマクロにショートカットキーを設定すれば、好きなショートカットキーで任意のJavaScriptをFigma上で実行できるようになります。


■使用イメージ

下記投稿のようなFigma APIの実行を好きなショートカットキーで実行できるようになります。

https://twitter.com/31mskz10/status/1684541017561903104


これは下記のFigma APIを使ったJavaScriptをKeyboard Maestroでコピーし、プラグインを実行して実現しています。

const selection = figma.currentPage.selection.slice()
for (let node of selection) {
node.resize(200, 300)
}
62054.tagline: Execute the JavaScript copied to the clipboard.

plugins.name: Coolrasto Icons - Custom Icon Library & Manager
plugins.description:
Coolrasto – 7000+ Free SVG Icons for Figma 🖼️✨


Coolrasto is a powerful Figma plugin offering 7000+ free, high-quality SVG icons with a modern rounded border style. Designed for speed and simplicity, it features instant search, organized categories, and a clean, minimal interface that fits perfectly into any design workflow.


✅ Free and easy to use

🎯 Smart search & filters to find the perfect icon fast

📁 Well-organized categories for quick navigation

🔄 Consistent rounded style – great for modern UI/UX

⚡ Fast and lightweight – no clutter, no sign-up required


Whether you're designing websites, apps, dashboards, or prototypes – Coolrasto helps you work faster and look better.


👉 Try Coolrasto and access thousands of icons without leaving Figma!

plugins.name: Webtistic Pro (AI Agents - Figma to Code)
plugins.description:
🚀 How To Use?

  1. Install Webtistic Pro from Figma store. This plugin is free to use.
  2. Run the plugin and select your design component.
  3. Click ‘Convert to Code’ -> Get high-quality react code.


🚀 Ship pixel-perfect React components faster than ever

✨ From Figma to fully responsive code in one click

⚡️ Built for modern React development workflows

Start for free today! No credit card required.

What can you do with Webtistic?

🧑‍💻 Enterprise-Grade React Generation

  1. Type-safe components with TypeScript support
  2. Optimized for performance and accessibility
  3. Clean, maintainable code architecture

🛠️ Built for Modern Developer Workflow

  1. Git-ready code formatting
  2. Zero vendor lock-in - 100% exportable code

⏳Save Developer Time

  1. Save upto 90% of time spent on coding pixel-perfect design requirements.

💪 Why choose Webtistic?

  1. The fastest plugin on the market. Does not hang your system.
  2. Based on highly fine-tuned AI Agents. Gives high-quality code.
  3. Totally free to use. No credit card required.

🔥 Coming Soon

  1. Support for multiple react frameworks: Ant Design, Tailwind CSS, Daisy UI, Material Tailwind.
  2. Support for different coding styles: CSS/Less/Styled.
  3. Code Export to IDE. Directly export code to VSCode (Accessible via our VSCode Plugin).
  4. Support for large component conversion: Multifile Code generation.
  5. Support for animated component conversion: Carousels, Dropdowns, Paginated Tables, etc.
plugins.tagline: Transform your designs to production-grade react code with AI Agents

plugins.name: Export variables to Github repository
plugins.description:
Introduction


Export all Figma variables as .json file to a Github repository.

All variables collections are exported.


Variables json structure is mapped from the getLocalVariablesAsync api function as following:

{
id: variable.id,
name: variable.name,
type: variable.resolvedType,
values: variable.valuesByMode
}


Plugin settings


Username: the username of the repository owner.

Repository: the name of the repository.

Path: the folders path where to save the variables file. Folder and sub folders must already exist in your repo.

File name: the name of the variables file.

Access Token: the Github access token needed to push on your repository. The access token must have read and write permission for Contents. Check the documentation on how to create an access token.

Commit message: add a short comment related to the modifications done.


All the settings are mandatory but the commit message.


Plugin functionalities


Save & Export: save the settings and push the variables file to your repository.

Download: locally download the variables file.

Reset settings: reset the plugin settings to default.
plugins.tagline: Export variables to Github repository

plugins.name: Drag & Drop FPO
plugins.description:
Drag & Drop FPO : Anywhere in your layout


As the name suggest, drag & drop the FPO marker over the content or images in your layout that are placeholder content. It helps communicate within the internal team or the clients or dev team, as to which content will be updated in future.


If your designs are in Auto-Layout, the dropped "FPO" will be positioned "ABSOLUTE" and won't interfere within the set auto-layout.


"FPO" placed over the frame without the auto-layout will appear on top-left corner.


Feel Free to reach out with any Feedback, thanks for using the plugin !
plugins.tagline: Drag & Drop FPO anywhere in your layout

plugins.name: [QUON] Design Tools
plugins.description: This tool was developed to address the "little annoyances" in design work. Its main features include the ability to adjust the selected object to a specific ratio, split specific shapes, and round off decimal points. Additionally, it has functions to split text line by line or at each blank line, and to remove all line breaks. Moreover, within the scope of user-defined groups or frames, you can easily select elements based on various combinations of common properties such as width, fill, and position.
plugins.tagline: Streamline design with ratio adjustments, shape splitting, text tools, and property-based selection.
